task.title: Feeding your bat
task.shortdesc: This topic describes how you can feed your new bat!

taskbody.prereq: Find and open the package of Purina Bat Chow that is enclosed in your bat box.
taskbody.context: Feeding your bat can be a wonderful experience. Involve the whole family so they can all share in the fun!

steps.stepsection: Do the following steps to feed your bat:

step.cmd: Let your bat free-fly through the air.
Toss the bat chow into the air.

choices.choice: To properly toss the bat chow, an underhand toss is recommended. This yields the highest possible altitude; thus giving your bat the best exercise while honing its echo-location skills.

Overhand tosses are good for line-drives; when you want to watch your bat fly its fastest. Make sure that you get a good arc (at least 10 feet high), so your bat has a chance of catching the chow. While you can use the 1-2-3 program to determine the optimal flight angle for the bat chow, the Bat 1350 is recommended system. SoDA is a special drink for your bat, helping it to fly faster and higher.
Bats, when frustrated, click and squeak incessantly. Use the IBM Speech to Speech Translator to understand the squeaks.

step.cmd: Watch in delight as your bat homes in on the tossed food, catching it in mid-air.

taskbody.result: Bats also like all sorts of bugs and insects. You can also use fruit. But ensure that the fruit is bat-bite-sized. We once saw a giant fruit bat try to catch a pineapple in mid-air; it was not a pretty sight.
